timeline.title: ADSL & Cable broadband arrive
timeline.text: Urban Panama gets online primarily via DSL from Cable & Wireless and cable internet from Cable Onda.

timeline.title: New mobile competitors
timeline.text: Claro and Digicel enter, intensifying competition alongside Movistar (+Movil/Cable & Wireless).

timeline.title: ‘Internet Para Todos’ / Red Nacional de Internet (RNI)
timeline.text: Government-backed Wi-Fi program begins expanding public access points; complemented by Infoplazas community centers nationwide.

timeline.title: 700 MHz awards & first LTE launches
timeline.text: Regulator assigns 700 MHz APT spectrum; +Movil (CWP) and Claro launch 4G LTE, improving coverage and speeds.

timeline.title: Market consolidation (Millicom)
timeline.text: Millicom acquires Cable Onda (2018) and Telefónica/Movistar Panama (2019), later rebranding to Tigo (2020).

timeline.title: Claro integrated into +Movil (CWP)
timeline.text: Cable & Wireless Panamá completes acquisition of Claro Panamá; Digicel files for liquidation and exits the market.

timeline.title: Starlink launches in Panama
timeline.text: LEO satellite broadband becomes available nationwide, complementing rural connectivity initiatives.

timeline.title: 5G preparations & pilots
timeline.text: +Movil (CWP) prepares and pilots 5G; ASEP later announces +Movil’s commercial 5G launch in Nov 2024. Tigo prepares 5G as well.

subsea_cables.name: PCCS (Pacific Caribbean Cable System)
subsea_cables.notes: 6000 km trunk; connects Florida–Ecuador with branches; strengthens Panama’s dual-ocean hub role.

subsea_cables.name: Curie (Google)
subsea_cables.notes: US–Chile private cable with Panama branch; boosts capacity and latency via PDG CLS.

subsea_cables.name: Maya-1
subsea_cables.notes: Regional system linking US–Mexico–Central America–Colombia with a Panama landing.

subsea_cables.name: Pan-American Crossing (PAC)
subsea_cables.notes: Self-healing ring linking US–Mexico–Central & South America with a Panama Pacific landing.

subsea_cables.name: South American Crossing (SAC)
subsea_cables.notes: Dual-ocean presence around Panama; now part of larger regional networks.

ixp.name: InteRed Panamá (IXP)
ixp.notes: National Internet Exchange Point improving local traffic and latency; ties into Curie landing and backbone.

public_programs.name: Infoplazas AIP
public_programs.notes: Digital inclusion, training and access kiosks across provinces and comarcas.

public_programs.name: Red Nacional de Internet (RNI) / Internet para Todos
public_programs.notes: Public Wi-Fi program coordinated by AIG; upgrades and coverage expansion supported by multilateral financing.

highlights: 700 MHz (APT) awards enable wide-area LTE starting 2014–2015.
ASEP announced +Movil’s commercial 5G launch in Nov 2024; Tigo preparing 5G.
Operators also utilize PCS (1900 MHz) and AWS (1700/2100 MHz) holdings for 3G/4G.
